name: regular
description: Let $f : X \to Y$ be a morphism of schemes, and assume that all fibers $X_y$ are locally Noetherian. Then $f$ is regular at $x \in X$ if $f$ is flat at $x$ and the fiber $X_{f(x)}$ is geometrically regular at $x$ over $\kappa(y)$. The morphism $f$ is regular if it is regular at each $x \in X$.
